metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3945 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in the (1) cvt_by_strip and (2) cvt_by_tilefunctions in the tiff2rgba tool in LibTIFF 4.0.6 and earlier, when -b modeis enabled, allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) orexecute arbitrary code via a crafted TIFF image, which triggers anout-of-bounds write.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3945` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6').
